briefTitle: A Study of Intravenous Mircera in Dialysis Patients With Chronic Renal Disease and Anemia.
officialTitle: A Single-arm, Open Label Multicenter Study to Assess the Efficacy, Safety and Tolerability of Once Monthly Administration of C.E.R.A. for the Maintenance of Hemoglobin Levels in Dialysis Patients With Chronic Renal Anemia
summary: This single arm study will assess the efficacy, safety and tolerability of monthly intravenous Mircera for the maintenance of hemoglobin levels in dialysis patients with chronic renal disease, currently receiving epoetin alfa or beta. Patients will receive monthly intravenous injections of Mircera at a starting dose of 120, 200 or 360 micrograms/month, depending on the dose of epoetin alfa or beta they were receiving in the week preceding study start. The anticipated time on study treatment is 3-12 months, and the target sample size is 100-500 individuals.

primaryOutcome.measure: Percentage of Participants Maintaining Average Hemoglobin Concentration Within +\- 1 Gram/Deciliter of Their Reference Hb and Between 10.5 and 12.5 Gram/Deciliter During EEP
